title: US, China Meet On Rare Earths Trade
description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondents Joe Mathieu and Kailey Leinz discuss high-level negotiations between the US and China in London. On today's show,  Bloomberg Chief Political Correspondent Annmarie Hordern, Wiley Rein Partner Nazak Nikakhtar, Center for the Study of the Presidency and Congress Senior Democracy Fellow Jeanne Sheehan Zaino, Former RNC Communications Director Lisa Camooso Miller, Bloomberg Tech Co-Host Ed Ludlow and Attorney Robert McWhirter. (Source: Bloomberg)

summary: The world's two largest economies, the US and China, are meeting in London to discuss the "BALANCE of Power" between them. The S & P 500 is currently hovering above 6,000 points, with the S&P 500 also rising. The focus of the meeting is on the issue of Exports Control and Exports from China to the U.S. of critical minerals, particularly from China, which has been trying to restrict Chinese technological advancements. Meanwhile, there are reports that President Trump is encouraging his NEGOTIATORS to loosen up the Export Control System in the US, which he has been putting in place to counterbalance Chinese technology advancements. The meeting is seen as a necessary step forward in the process of resolving this issue.
